parse: Conjunction
str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shout, exclaim. From krauge; to clamor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Demonstrative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Adverb
str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Conjunction
str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Article - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
